title: Rubber Industry Resurgence - DailyNews
text: Exporting rubber worldwide, Sri Lanka was regarded as the cradle for natural rubber several decades ago. Regrettably, today our rubber industry has rebounded, facing many challenges and issues. Rubber farmers tend to give up planting rubber due to various reasons such as inadequate infrastructure, adverse climatic changes, leaf fall diseases, the skyrocketing cost of fertilizers, lack of skillful tappers, insufficient revenue, unavailability of high-yielding clones, lack of knowledge of tapping technology, and reduction of rubber lands, among others. In this backdrop, our natural rubber production has declined by 6,000 MT from 2021 to 2022. According to the Rubber Research Institute, rubber production was at 152,100 MT in 2012. It is regrettable to say that it had dropped to 70,870 MT in 2022. The country requires around 140,000 MT of rubber for local consumption. Can we expect rubber farmers to grin and bear the loss? To shed light on the key issues prevailing in our rubber industry, the Daily News spoke to the Rubber Research Institute and Rubber Development Officers. Leaf Fall Disease The leaf fall disease caused by a fungal pathogen was first detected in July 2019. The prevailing leaf fall disease is known as Pesta or Circular Leaf Spot Disease, and its spread depends on the location. There are more factors contributing to the widespread of the disease, such as lack of fertilizer, adverse climatic conditions, excessive harvesting, poor maintenance, and so on. The Rubber Research Institute has introduced several clones, including RRI100, RRI2006, and Centennial 4, which are tolerant to Pesta leaf fall disease. Not only the clones, but RRISL has also recommended preventive measures such as long-term, short-term, and mid-term strategies to mitigate the damages caused by the disease. But the issue is the fact that most rubber farmers had not been made aware of such new preventive measures and clones. Hence, it is important to educate low-scale, medium-scale, and large-scale rubber landowners on such new changes. In addition, rubber development officer Chaminda Pasqual said that fertilizer for rubber trees should be made available at an affordable price so that anyone can purchase. Apart from the disease, one of the major problems is the reduction of rubber lands. It has been reported that our country has lost a considerable number of rubber lands during the past 4-5 decades as a result of money-losing development projects. Stern actions should be taken to allocate more lands. Rain Guard Technology The Rubber Research Institute introduced the rain guard technology in 1992 with the objective of helping rubber farmers to continue harvesting without any losses on rainy days. On the other hand, the Rubber Research Institute does not recommend tapping on rainy days, considering the damages that can be caused by fungi which grow on leaves. There are four types of rain guards such as ‘Tapping Shade,’ ‘polythene skirt,’ ‘Guardian Rain guard,’ and ‘Tapping Shield.’ Rain guards are made of polythene and are more convenient to fix to the trunk of the rubber tree. However, from the perspective of small-scale rubber plantation owners, the price of a rain guard is not affordable. Hence, it is not possible to purchase rain guards at a higher price in this critical situation. There are many issues that went unnoticed by relevant authorities. Adverse weather conditions are also a major problem. Rubber landowners and tappers are tuned in to the rubber tapping techniques and diseases. This is why country-wide awareness programs should be conducted by the Rubber Research Institute, targeting both the rubber plantation owners and tappers,” said Pasqual. Rubber Clones There are high-yielding clones recommended by the Rubber Research Institute, such as RRIC 100, RRIC 121, RRIC 102, etc. However, most rubber farmers are engaged in daily tapping with the intention of compensating for losses. Therefore, rubber trees have faced daily tapping dryness (TDP). From the perspective of small-scale rubber farmers, PB 86 is tolerant to daily tapping, unlike the recommended clones. As noted by Chaminda Pasqual, considering adverse climatic conditions, most small-scale and medium-scale rubber farmers demand PB 86 rubber clones for their plantations. However, according to the Rubber Research Institute, in 1995, the Ministry of Plantation Industries decided to eliminate the low-yielding clone PB 86 from rubber plantations and bud wood nurseries. It is evident that a certain level of educational program should be recommended for both rubber plantation owners and tappers under the direction of the Rubber Research Institute and the Rubber Development Board. If not, it is impossible to prevent our rubber industry from bouncing back. Furthermore, Chaminda said that it is essential to take steps to limit the import of rubber and increase local rubber production. For this to happen, entrepreneurs should be encouraged to manufacture local rubber-based products. Skillful Young Tappers Tappers engaged in tapping are old and feeble. Most tappers are reluctant to stay in the field because of insufficient wages. Hence, there must be a strong mechanism to attract young and skillful tappers to make the rubber industry more sustainable. The Assistant Manager of C. W. Mackie PLC, Ajith Wahalathanthri, said that the time is ripe to attract young and skillful tappers by providing a training program. As stressed by Ajith, even 80-year-old tappers can be seen working on rubber plantations. Needless to say, it is difficult to increase the productivity of the local rubber industry in this situation. In addition, new techniques should be introduced to rubber landowners by the Rubber Research Institute without any delay.

author: Staff reports
title: Forgiving our spouse for not being perfect
text:
Forgiving our spouse for not being perfect
Published 3:55 pm Thursday, January 23, 2025
If you’ve already blown your New Year’s resolutions, I have a suggestion. Resolve to do only one thing this new year: Forgive your spouse for not being perfect.
Several years ago, while our Sunday school class discussed issues relating to married life, Bert said, “Our marriage isn’t perfect—”
I couldn’t help but interrupt. “Oh, Hon. Now they know!” The class chuckled a neither-is-our-marriage-perfect kind of chuckle.
Why do we behave as if we expect our marriages to be perfect? As we pledged our “I do’s,” we dreamt of “happily ever after.” We naively resolved never to let anything come between us – between two imperfect people – until death do us part. It didn’t take long for reality to set in.
But perhaps it would be possible to live a realistic version of “happily ever after” if we heeded Proverbs 19:11 (ESV): “Good sense makes one slow to anger, and it is his glory to overlook an offense.”
Overlooking offenses isn’t about ignoring real issues, but about choosing grace over frustration in everyday moments.
Don’t we always appreciate it when our spouse shows us grace for our annoying and unloving ways? What would happen in our marriages if we consistently applied Proverbs 19:11 to the way we treated our spouse? Rather than overreacting to their maddening quirks, what if we practiced discretion by holding our tongue?
When we respond generously (rather than reacting) when our spouse behaves in less-than-loving ways, we can demonstrate a level of maturity that will earn their respect. When we cease to nitpick them for not being as “perfect as we are,” imagine how it will change the way they feel about coming home at night.
If we continue to apply Proverbs 19:11, we may be surprised by how much it changes our perspective about our spouse. When we stop focusing on their imperfections, it becomes easier to see their good qualities.
A word of caution: Applying this week’s verse will not be easy. Our spouse will probably not be any more perfect today than yesterday. Our husband might still leave their socks on the floor or not load the dishwasher the “right way.” Your wife may still struggle with prioritizing and procrastinating.
But consider the alternative.
What might our marriage look like by the end of 2025 if we keep nitpicking and overreacting to every flaw? Could our relationship become so strained that no resolution could repair the damage? Heaven forbid.
Sheryl H. Boldt is a faith columnist and the author of the blog www.TodayCanBeDifferent.net. You can reach her at SherylHBoldt@gmail.com.

Mansoor spent nearly five years as an active competitor in the Stamford-based company. He wrestled on NXT, 205 Live, Monday Night RAW, and SmackDown. However, the 28-year-old Saudi star was released from his contract nearly three months ago.
During a recent interview with Denise Salcedo on Instinct Culture , Mansoor claimed he was forbidden to lose any matches by orders of Vince McMahon. He claimed the stipulation prevented him from challenging for the Cruiserweight Title during his run on WWE 205 Live:
"I was being lined up to be a part of NXT and then I found out that I wasn't on TV because I wasn't allowed to lose. After the Cesaro match [at Crown Jewel 2019], I started winning house shows and eventually at some point I realized I was never losing. And I was like, 'What's going on?' And then I ended up being like, I kept talking to the writers in NXT, like, 'Here's my ideas.' And they were like, 'We really want to get you on but we keep getting the red light we don't know why.' And then finally they told me, 'Hey, Vince said you can't lose,'" he said. [25:28 - 25:55] The released superstar added:
"And their hands were tied. How are they gonna put me on NXT when they gotta book me, you know, 200-pound, six-foot guy Goldberg [laughs], you know what I mean? Like, it wasn't gonna happen. Thankfully, they put me, I had a really fun great run on 205 Live but I wasn't allowed to challenge for the championship because if I won the da*n thing, I wasn't allowed to lose it." title: गजब की कंजूस है महिला, पैसे बचाने के चक्कर में नहीं खाती ढंग से खाना, पुरानी सब्ज़ी-सलाद से चलाती है काम
text:
गजब की कंजूस है महिला, पैसे बचाने के चक्कर में नहीं खाती ढंग से खाना, पुरानी सब्ज़ी-सलाद से चलाती है काम
महिला खुद बताती है कि वो पैसे बचाने के लिए कुछ भी कर सकती है. यहां तक कि वो अपने सीरियल्स में दूध की जगह पानी डाल लेती है और सब्ज़ी खराब भी हो गई हो, तो खा लेती है.
आपने बहुत से ऐसे लोगों के बारे में सुना होगा, जो ज्यादा से ज्यादा पैसे बचाना चाहते हैं और कम से कम खर्च करना चाहते हैं. वे इसके लिए अपना बजट इस तरह से बनाते हैं, जिसमें खर्चा ज्यादा हो ही नहीं. चाहे खाने-पीने की बात हो या फिर पहनने-ओढ़ने की, हर जगह कटौती की जाती है. हालांकि ऐसी कटौती शायद ही किसी ने की होगी, जैसी एक महिला कर रही है.
सोशल मीडिया पर ये महिला खुद बताती है कि वो पैसे बचाने के लिए कुछ भी कर सकती है. यहां तक कि वो अपने सीरियल्स में दूध की जगह पानी डाल लेती है और सब्ज़ी खराब भी हो गई हो, तो खा लेती है. 32 साल की इस महिला ने खुद को अपने आप ही कंजूस घोषित कर दिया है और बताया है कि वो किस-किस तरह से पैसे बचा रही है.
‘मैं तो बिल्कुल खर्चा नहीं करती’
महिला ने सोशल मीडिया पर अपनी कंजूसी का बखान करते हुए बताया है कि वो 32 साल की उम्र में इसलिए बिना किसी लोन के जी रही है क्योंकि वो बहुत कंजूस है. उसने दिखाया कि वो खाने-पीने में भी काफी कटौती करती है. नाश्ते में वो अपने सीरियल्स में दूध की जगह पानी का इस्तेमाल करती है. वो टंकी के पानी को उसमें डालकर खा लेती है और उसका दावा कि स्वाद में कोई खास फर्क नहीं होता. डिनर के लिए तो अगर घर में बच्चे और पति न हों, तो वो एक्सपायरी डेट बीत चुकने वाले सलाद को भी धोकर खा लेती है.
ऐसा कौन करता है भाई?
इतना ही नहीं वो उन आलुओं का भी इस्तेमाल करती है, जो अंकुरित हो चुके हैं और खाने के लिए अच्छे नहीं माने जाते. फ्रिज में जो कुछ भी पड़ा होता है, वो हर बची हुई चीज़ का इस्तेमाल करती है और उसे सैंडविच में डाल देती है. स्नैक्स के तौर पर वो जानवरों वाले बिस्किट और ब्लूबेरीज़ खाती है. महिला की इस कहानी को सुनने के बाद सोशल मीडिया पर लोगों ने कमेंट में लिखा कि ज़िंदगी बहुत छोटी है, ये सब खाने के लिए. वहीं एक यूज़र ने तो इस पर दुख ज़ाहिर किया कि कोई सिंक के पानी को कैसे यूज़ करता है?
